greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular matrix T, read by rows, that satisfies: SHIFT_LEFT(column 0 of T^p) = p*(column p+3 of T), or [T^p](m,0) = p*T(p+m,p+3) for all m>=1 and p>=-3.
comment: Column 0 equals A111530 (related to log of factorial series). Column 3 (A111547) equals SHIFT_LEFT(column 0 of log(T)), where the matrix logarithm, log(T), equals the integer matrix A111549.
link: Paul Barry, A note on number triangles that are almost their own production matrix, arXiv:1804.06801 [math.CO], 2018.
example: SHIFT_LEFT(column 0 of log(T)) = column 3 of T;
where SHIFT_LEFT of column sequence shifts 1 place left.
After initial term, column 2 is 3 times column 0.
where columns are all equal after initial terms;
compare columns of T^-1 to column 2 of T.
compare column 0 of log(T) to column 3 of T.
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Aug 09 2018, from PARI *)
xref: Cf. A111545 (column 1), A111546 (column 2), A111547 (column 3), A111552 (row sums), A111548 (matrix inverse), A111549 (matrix log); related tables: A111528, A104980, A111536, A111553.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 07 2005
